New Records: Lautaro Martínez is the tournament’s top scorer with nine goals in the Copa America 2024
Key Match Events: Lautaro Martínez scored the opening goal in the 47th minute and the second goal in the 86th minute
Pre-Game Insights: Argentina were already into the quarter-finals with a game to spare
Post-Match Reflections: Argentina will face the runner-up of Group B in their quarter-final
Miscellaneous Highlights: Peru were eliminated from the Copa America with just one point
Others: Argentina averaged 74% possession against Peru, matching their second-highest possession rate in the CONMEBOL Copa América since at least the 2011 edition
Argentina concluded their participation in the group stage of the 2024 CONMEBOL Copa América with three wins in three matches without conceding any goals while scoring all their goals after half-time
Lautaro Martínez, despite not starting in two out of the three matches, finished the group stage as the Argentine player with the most shots (9) and the most goals (four out of Argentina’s five)
Out of the last 16 penalties taken against Peru in the CONMEBOL Copa América (including shootouts), seven were not converted (44%)
